---
title: "Styling Guide"
---

## Theme Files

This template uses two styling files:

### claude-theme.scss
The main theme file with color palette and component styling. Edit this to change:

- **Colors**: Modify SCSS variables at the top
- **Component styles**: Sidebar, navbar, buttons, tables, callouts

```scss
// Change the primary color
$claude-orange: #C15F3C;  // Replace with your brand color
```

### styles.css
Contains specific overrides and fixes. You usually won't need to edit this unless you want to:

- Adjust spacing
- Override specific Quarto defaults
- Add custom CSS rules

## Color Palette

The template uses these colors:

| Variable | Color | Usage |
|----------|-------|-------|
| `$claude-orange` | #C15F3C | Primary accent color |
| `$claude-white` | #FFFFFF | Backgrounds |
| `$body-color` | #2C2C2C | Text color |

## Changing Colors

Edit `claude-theme.scss` and update the SCSS variables:

```scss
/*-- scss:defaults --*/

$claude-orange: #YOUR-COLOR;  // Your brand color
$primary: $claude-orange;
```

## Advanced Customization

### Add a Custom CSS Class

In `claude-theme.scss`, add custom rules:

```scss
.my-custom-class {
  background-color: $claude-orange;
  padding: 1rem;
  border-radius: 6px;
}
```

Then use it in your content:

```markdown
::: {.my-custom-class}
This content has custom styling
:::
```

### Modify Component Spacing

Edit spacing values in `claude-theme.scss`:

```scss
main {
  padding: 2rem 3rem;  // Adjust content padding
}
```
